instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879B: What is 820-2879B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no headphone jack
threads.message: This macbook have chime, speaker works normally, but if i insert headphone, it can detect the headphone but the sound is nearly non existent, but i can hear the songâ€™s bass thumping a little, what i have tried is removing <RESISTOR>R6805</RESISTOR>, change <CHIP>U6700</CHIP>, changing blown DZ6705

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no headphone jack
threads.message:
If <DIODE>D6705</DIODE> was blown, did you check L6705?
Also check L6704 and all resistors around <CHIP>U6700</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no headphone jack
threads.message: L6705 , l6704 and resistor all are fine, any chance of bad jack?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no headphone jack
threads.message: Missing sound on speakers, or headphones only?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no headphone jack
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no headphone jack
threads.message: Try to clean audio jack first; some videos available on Internet...
